segments.lesson_summary: Summary of segment 3: When we multiply a number by 100, we add two zeroes to the right of the original number, and the opposite happens when we divide or decrease a number. For example, if we have a word like "אלאדם רמח איברים ושסה גידים," how many words and cheeks does a person have? How many days are counted from the beginning of the counting of the Omer until Lag BaOmer? It is said in Pirkei Avot, "בן ח לחופה," at what age do we get married according to this saying? In the number line in the field of multiplication, 3 is placed straight on the numbers. For example, place the number 9,000 straight on the numbers. Learning about the location of numbers helps us understand how they relate to each other and how they can be manipulated in math problems.
